definitions.definition: a building or set of buildings at an airport where passengers arrive and leave

examples.text: A second terminal was opened last year.

definitions.definition: a place, building or set of buildings where journeys by train, bus or boat begin or end

examples.text: The new high-speed train will stop at a terminal to be built at Kings Cross station.
They intend to build a massive new rail terminal.
When I woke up I was in the bus terminal.

definitions.definition: a piece of equipment, usually consisting of a keyboard and a screen that joins the user to a central computer system

examples.text: Internet terminals have been installed at most libraries.
All she did was press a few keys on the terminal.
The larger financial institutions have over 200 news and data terminals in their offices.
There were two students at each terminal.

definitions.definition: a point at which connections can be made in an electric circuit

wordOrigin: early 19th cent.: from Latin terminalis, from terminus ‘end, boundary’.
